intro: Curanga fel-terrae, commonly known as the earth-joy plant, is a rare flowering species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and waxy, dark green leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its unique ability to absorb minerals from the soil contributes to its medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is now classified as an endangered species.
